intro: Pouzolzia orientalis, commonly known as the oriental pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in spikes. Pouzolzia orientalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
